alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion County through 945 PM EDT... At 914 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Santos, or near Ocala, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Juniper Springs, Lynne, Weirsdale, The Village of Briar Meadow, Ocklawaha, Moss Bluff, Silver Springs Shores, Lake Weir and Santos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion
